Your inventive pursuits have led to you employ an advanced suit of technology that serves as a conduit for your Techcasting. You gain Augmented Armor, which can be activated for a predefined duration a number of times equal to your Intelligence Modifier between Long Rests. The traits you gain while the Augmented Armor is active are as follows:
  • Activation: As a Bonus Action, you can activate or deactivate the Augmented Armor, or choose to deploy or retract the helmet.
  • Duration: Your Augmented Armor lasts for a number of minutes equal to your Intelligence Modifier
  • Armor Class: You gain an Armor Class bonus equal to your Intelligence Modifier.
  • Strength: Your Strength score becomes equal to your Intelligence score as long as it is not already higher.
  • Casting Focus: You can use the Augmented Armor as a Techcasting focus for your Visionary spells.
  • Irremovable: The Augmented Armor attaches to you and can't be removed against your will.
  • Augmentation: The Augmented Armor expands to cover your entire body, replacing any missing limbs and functioning identically to a limb it replaces.
At level 12, your Augmented Armor gains the following additional features:
  • Activation: As a Reaction when you are hit by an Attack or forced to make a Saving Throw, you can activate or deactivate the Augmented Armor, or choose to deploy or retract the helmet.
  • Intelligence Checks: When you make an Intelligence check, you can treat the d20 result as equal to half of your Intelligence score (rounded down) if the result before modifiers is lower.
  • Vacuum Capability: You can survive in the vacuum of space for a number of hours equal to your Intelligence modifier. This ability recharges upon a Long Rest within a hospitable environment.
At level 18, your Augmented Armor gains the following additional features:
  • Activation: As a part of any Action, Bonus Action, or Reaction you take, you can don or doff the Augmented Armor, or choose to deploy or retract the helmet.
  • Casting Focus: You are always considered to possess a Techcasting focus as components of the Augmented Armor dynamically deploy and retract as needed.
  • Intelligence Checks: When you make an Intelligence check, you can treat the d20 result as equal to your Intelligence score if the result before modifiers is lower.
  • Vacuum Capability: You can survive in the vacuum of space for a number of days equal to your Intelligence modifier. This ability recharges upon a Long Rest within a hospitable environment.

You learn a number of Strategies equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and can learn additional Strategies to reflect your Proficiency Bonus or swap one Strategy for another on each subsequent level up. You gain a number of Strategy Dice equal to your Proficiency Bonus, which are d8s. The Strategies are as follows:
  • Coordinated Attack: When you hit a target with an Attack, you can expend a Strategy Die to forgo a subsequent attack. You may then direct an Ally to expend their Reaction and move up to their speed towards the same target, making one Attack against the target if they are able to get within range and adding the Strategy Die to their Attack roll. .

  • Defensive Stance: You may use a Bonus Action to expend a Strategy Die, increasing your AC by the amount rolled until the end of your next turn. While you benefit from this AC increase, you do not provoke Opportunity Attacks.

  • Disarming Strike: When you hit a target with an Attack, you can expend a Strategy Die and add the result to the damage roll. In addition, the target must make a Strength saving throw, dropping one item of your choice that it's holding at any point within 15 of the target of your choosing upon failure. .

  • Distracting Strike: When you hit a target with an Attack, you can expend a Strategy Die and add the result to the damage roll. In addition, you grant all creatures other than you advantage on all Attacks against the target until the end of your next turn.

  • Feinting Attack: You may use a Bonus Action to expend a Strategy Die, gaining advantage on all Attack rolls against that target until the start of your next turn. The first time you hit that target while this effect is active, you may add the Strategy Die to that damage roll. .

  • Focused Agility: When you make a Dexterity or Strength check, you can expend a Strategy Die to gain advantage on the check and add the result to your total.

  • Grappling Strike: When you hit a target with an Attack, you can expend a Strategy Die to attempt to Grapple the target and add the Strategy Die to your Strength (Athletics) check.

  • Parry: When an Attack made by a target you are aware of misses you, you may use a Reaction to expend a Strategy Die and reduce the incoming damage by an amount equal to the Strategy Die + your Dexterity Modifier or half of the incoming damage.

  • Repelling Attack: When you hit a target with an Attack, you can expend a Strategy Die and add the result to the damage roll. In addition, the target must make a Strength Saving Throw if they are no more than one size category larger than you, being pushed 20 feet away from you upon failure.

  • Riposte: When an Attack made by a target you are aware of misses you, you may use a Reaction to expend a Strategy Die and make an Attack against the target, add the Strategy Die to that damage roll.

  • Trip Attack: When you hit a target with an Attack, you can expend a Strategy Die and add the result to the damage roll. In addition, the target must make a Strength Saving Throw if they are no more than one size category larger than you, being knocked prone upon failure.

  • Vigilance: When a target you are aware of moves into your reach, you may use a Reaction to expend a Strategy Die and make an Attack against the target, adding the Strategy Die to that damage roll.
At level 13, your Strategy Dice become d10s. At level 20, your Strategy Dice become d12s, and you gain two Strategy Dice if you roll Initiative with less than two Strategy Dice remaining.

You are able to create an illusory puppet as a Bonus Action called a Mirage. You may choose to have the Mirage take the appearance of any Medium creature you have seen, and you have +5 to all Charisma related checks when interacting as the Mirage. Choose two of the following Metapowers. When you cast a Superpower, you may choose to add the chosen effect for this casting only:

Choose one of the following mobility options:

  • Speed: Your movement speed increases by an amount equal to (Class Level + Proficiency Bonus) * 10, and you may move along vertical and liquid surfaces as though they were solid ground, but you fall at the end of your turn if you did not use your full movement this turn.

You may make a number of Shove Attacks equal to your Powercasting Ability Modifier as a Bonus Action, and you may use the Acrobatics skill rather than Athletics when you do so.

  • Speed: You are now able to pass through solid matter as though it were difficult terrain. If you end your turn within solid matter, you take one point of exhaustion.

Immediately after the Attack is resolved, if you did not use half of your movement speed to reach the target, you can use any remaining movement speed from that pool to position yourself at your discretion.
